column1: I am proud to join @floodcoalition and honored to be named a Federal Champion. Bringing attention to the need for real solutions for a more resilient future is critical is nonpartisan and is most effective with this diverse coalition of communities and stakeholders. https://t.co/xAQtvuQw13

ICYMI - Yesterday’s @HoustonChron covered some of the highlights of my first year in Congress.  In 2018 I promised to bring a little more Houston to DC—that means working together to get things done.  And I will keep doing so in 2020.  Read more:    https://t.co/9ESjobiWSK

It’s Election Day #HTown! I voted &  appreciate seeing the friendly people at the polls making sure things run smoothly for all! A beautiful day to head to the polls! And you can find one near you right now at https://t.co/x6dqqsZcdV. https://t.co/d008vsZBgR
#TBT  https://t.co/17rwMWfvEp

In 2018 #TeamLizzie built a #TX07 coalition that brought a new message to Congress.   Today I was proud to put my name on the 2020 ballot for re-election so we can continue to bring a little more Houston to Washington DC. https://t.co/1ohWzqsqsX

Great to spend time with the Texas Humane Legislation Network to honor the work of @CarolforTexas & @whitmire_john and to hear from advocates working to stop animal cruelty. We are lucky to have such champions in #TXlege & I'm glad to advocate for animals in D.C. https://t.co/01LwRJVesM
Such a critical point to be repeated repeated repeated:  We don’t have to live this way.  Our children shouldn’t die this way. https://t.co/liNQWmEtkT
Thank you @emilyslist!  Glad and proud to have your support! #TX07 https://t.co/poslv27l2h

I am proud to endorse @SylvesterTurner for re-election. He has worked to expand our economy balance our budget and cut our pension debt and make our city a safer place to live and work.  We need that leadership as we face the challenges and opportunities before us. #TeamTurner https://t.co/O9kst0ov8Q
“a coalition of supporters worked tirelessly for this moment in 2018”    So true. So grateful. Thank you #TeamLizzie https://t.co/9qXmDiKOyj
This is huge and great news! https://t.co/9qLAprjey3
I always say we need a little more Houston in Washington D.C. Now we’ll have it. We will show them how we do things in H-Town when the @astros #TakeItBack! https://t.co/PN8SY5DvIH
He has never bothered to understand what actually happened or what we need to recover.  Of course we know these things in #TX07. And we know we deserve better.

Why he came to Texas is rather obvious. Why he thinks that calling hurting Texans some kind of hurricane profiteers is a winning message is a mystery. But it is not a surprise. It is a sign of his lack of empathy of understanding & of interest.

On other trips he has made the bizarre claim that our #HarveyHeroes were out in boats just watching the hurricane when they were actually out in their boats rescuing their neighbors from unprecedented flooding.
President Trump came to Texas last night for a rally.  And true to form he insulted us again this time claiming inexplicably that we “made a fortune" on hurricane #Harvey.  https://t.co/YJ4ueLES1G

In Houston we work together to solve problems. Tonight I’ll be watching the Democratic candidates for a message that echoes the values of this community: one that includes practical solutions collaborative strategies and an inclusive approach to bringing our country together. https://t.co/ipirsQ2PqO

Honored & proud to earn the endorsement of @PPact and grateful to have this partnership for my re-election campaign. PP’s advocacy for access to safe affordable nonjudgmental reproductive healthcare for all is critical as is the care it provides in #TX07 & across the country. https://t.co/53laSMw5QF

I was so sad to learn that @CJwritergirl died yesterday as were all of us on TeamLizzie. CJ was a true leader who gave her time and energy to benefit our community in so many ways. Our hearts go out to the @MeyerDems friends and all who are mourning her loss today.
Today 10/7 is the last day to register to vote for this fall’s elections. Be sure you are registered and make your voice heard! https://t.co/leNyUhXaFv
Thanks to all who came out for our  #TX07 Day of Action! Your continued support will help us continue to bring this community the representation we deserve! https://t.co/06E6c7cfpk

Happy 50th anniversary to NARAL Pro-Choice America! The work you do advocating for reproductive justice is vital to recognizing and making possible the equality of women and families across the country. #NARAL50 https://t.co/XSrD4t4ngL

Join Team Lizzie on Saturday October 5 for a #TX07 Day of Action. Bring your walking shoes and phone chargers -- we'll have fresh lit and call lists. And don't forget to RSVP via https://t.co/xTbwnbvjfk so we can be sure to have enough breakfast tacos! https://t.co/jYfOqwLNaY

Thank you @janadam2 and Bob Adam for hosting precinct chairs and volunteers in Katy. We increased the vote share in every #TX07 precinct in 2018 and organizing early will help us keep this seat in 2020! https://t.co/mqkzUhDEeH

Honored and proud to receive the endorsement of @HRC for my re-election. A critical part of our coalition in 2018 HRC’s continued partnership will allow us to build on our work and win again in 2020. https://t.co/kv2BvDqysG https://t.co/iakHP3UPWX

Tonight at the #DemDebate I will be watching for the candidates to speak to the issues we care about most in HTown: working together; solving problems with common sense facts & expertise; and ensuring government of by and for all of the people.   https://t.co/7FJzLah25y https://t.co/IedE9icxhU

Eighteen years ago our military first responders & everyday Americans bravely faced profound uncertainty & loss with action. We will #NeverForget those who died on September 11 and those who lost their lives later because they heeded the call to action to serve our country.

Today has been a day of service remembrance and reflection. It reminds us: out of many we are one. Americans. And there is no better example of that than our brave fellow citizens who we remember today.
Join Team Lizzie this Friday as we welcome @HRC to #TX07! Don't forget to RSVP: https://t.co/Eh7cxd7E5B. See you there! https://t.co/8xKtKNS4dV

As we approach Labor Day it was great to spend time with so many friends in the labor community this week talking about the issues that matter in this region state & country. Together we have achieved much and can achieve much more for working people across the country. https://t.co/AbVlPelHpC
#IStandWithPP https://t.co/y0T7W12UlQ
@PPFA That’s why I won’t stop working to support @PPACT and to #ProtectX.

Today the consequences of Trump’s Title X gag rule are being felt by women & families across the country. Here in the birthplace of Title X—#TX07—we know that losing providers like @PPFA means Americans are losing access to  health care. It happened here in TX. (See below.) https://t.co/kwmRnf4k91
.@USWNT you are an inspiration.  Thank you for using your talents and your voices to make history and change history for women everywhere. https://t.co/XSITjWrHHV
More great energy in #TX07 at Bellaire's 4th of July Celebration!  So fun to see friends & neighbors enjoying the day! https://t.co/N7uPJ2RSbH
Great to kick off July 4 celebration at the Memorial Villages Independence Festival.  Great to see so many #TX07 neighbors along the route and at the festival. https://t.co/jbxNNQkN7U
Many thanks to all the #TeamLizzie friends who have contributed!  There is still time to join them as Q2 contributors before midnight tonight. #TX07 https://t.co/AFMx3ZI0cA

Help #TeamLizzie reach our end-of-quarter fundraising goal by visiting https://t.co/AB6fYZgWfs.  Your support will make sure we have the resources we need to defend this critical seat and continue bringing Houston the representation we deserve. https://t.co/KnGdzhNBVD
Happy #FathersDay to the dads of #TeamLizzie -- and dads everywhere who are working to make the world a better place for all of our kids in so many ways! https://t.co/bAhabUD4Bm

On the 26th anniversary of our graduation a special shoutout to my SJS Class of '93 classmates who have block walked phone called cheered on and contributed to this campaign in so many ways.  #TeamLizzie https://t.co/b3AVhtAieb

Happy Pride Month! I am so proud to stand with the LGBTQ+ community in #TX07 and beyond.  Many many thanks to those members on Team Lizzie who worked so hard to bring home a victory for us all. @HGLBTCaucus @HRC @HRCHouston https://t.co/aVNT2Is0kS

Great to see friends at the annual @VictoryFund Houston brunch today!  Wonderful way to celebrate passing the Equality Act and to support LGBTQI candidates at home & across the country. https://t.co/tQSEZ7Q6eU

Women's access to safe affordable nonjudgmental reproductive health care including the right to choose abortion is under attack in Alabama and across the country. I am committed to protecting this right. We all can do something. Use your voice & vote. https://t.co/jNbN9qWhQa https://t.co/N6clbkzwvj

Happy #MothersDay to the many moms of #TeamLizzie and moms everywhere who are working to make the world a better place for our children and grandchildren--and raising them to do the same! https://t.co/AJVZjS6P6C

Two years ago today I launched my first campaign. Two years & too many friends to count later I am so grateful for the people who have supported engaged mentored encouraged & trusted me--who have made possible this incredible opportunity to serve. #TX07 #TeamLizzie https://t.co/55JGcHSteU
@ericswalwell @warriors @HoustonRockets Deal.  This is #ClutchCity where we #RunAsOne.  We look forward to drinking your wine!
So great to see so many friends today at the @AnniesListTX luncheon right here in #TX07!  2020 is around the corner.  Texas will be ready. https://t.co/XgBZ3U1Vee
Thank you #TeamLizzie for your incredible support. #TX07 https://t.co/NU5zLDzzLD via @politico

@ColinAllredTX @luka7doncic @dallasmavs @HoustonRockets My friend I’ll welcome you to Houston any time! But on this all I can say is you are mistaken. This is #ClutchCity where we #RunAsOne. I know - I’ve been a @Rockets fan since before you were born.  (PS: Happy Bday.) https://t.co/8qP3bBXhIg

So grateful for our growing coalition of support. Last night we filed our fundraising report for the first full Q of the cycle: more than $500000 raised since January & more than 70% of it from Houston-area residents. Thank you for your continued investment #TX07’s future.

Two years ago I met with @emilyslist to find out what it would take to run for Congress. Tonight we celebrated the work of those who asked the questions had the answers and made it happen. (And will make it happen again.) #WeAreEMILY. https://t.co/4H9kOMZBLe
Love this from @emilyslist an incredible organization that helps women candidates tackle fears run and win! https://t.co/iZgsiGTvHS
ICYMI.  We saw it in #TX07 in 2018. Texans are ready for representatives who will work for all of us. Together. https://t.co/eVofJOAMmJ
I am committed to using my voice to stand up for women across this country — for their equality dignity access to quality affordable nonjudgemental health care and for their right to choose.
I was honored to earn her support as a candidate and to be included in her interview about the case in last summer’s Glamour.  Read all the way to the end. https://t.co/XaNvbmXHJK

46 years ago today the Supreme Court handed down its decision in Roe v. Wade. The case was brought and argued in the Supreme Court by a 26 year old lawyer named Sarah Weddington. Her story is a lesson to all of us about the power of your voice & what you can do when you use it.

We are at a critical moment in our history. It is up to all of us now to join on that path for progress equality peace justice and democracy. Thank you to all of you who inspire me every day by working to get us there.

Among them I've had the incredible honor to get to know @RepJohnLewis on the campaign trail and now to serve beside him. Rep. Lewis personifies this life of sacrifice concern hope and perseverance we need to keep this country on the path of progress. https://t.co/rCynO0ZD6X
I am thinking today of all of the individuals who continue that essential work for progress and I am grateful for them. I have had the privilege of working with many of them because of this campaign.

Dr. King observed: “Human progress is neither automatic nor inevitable... Every step toward the goal of justice requires sacrifice suffering and struggle; the tireless exertions and passionate concern of dedicated individuals.”

Today we honor the memory of Dr. Martin Luther King and his service to our country. It is an opportunity for all of us to reflect on moral courage on the power of our voices and on what we can accomplish when we work together.
